intro: Astrantia pontica, commonly known as the Pontic aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a central disk of yellow stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy on the underside. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Astrantia pontica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
